Reviews.Title: “WOWwwww.... Superb stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brenhardt T
Reviews.Content: We have a very wonderful stay in this hotel. After a very tiring flight, a warm welcome for us from the reception makes us feel better and ending up for a very comfy room. The very best thing in this hotel is the location where it is nearer to everywhere. Concierge are so good and helpful to find a place you want. Additional on that is the beach access with free transfer where few city hotel can offer. Would recommend this for everyone, 99.9% thumbs up to Metropolitan Palace Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Dubai”
Reviews.Author: seamus2
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the unimpressive facade/entrance....inside there's all the usual marble flooring, fountains and chandeliers, although not over the top. It's not a big hotel and it consequently feels more intimate than most in this city. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, as are the bathrooms. The rooftop pool and surrounds are very pleasant. The hotel's location in Deira, on the north side of the Creek, suited us well as not everywhere has been concreted over with massive buildings and there are loads of Arab and Indian restaurants in the side streets. I can't comment on the hotel food as we ate in these restaurants the whole time (even for breakfast)...very tasty and 1/10 of hotel prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, for Shopping, Relaxing and Adventure”
Reviews.Author: Olivia D
Reviews.Content: the rooms are very clean, big and comfortable. The service ist kind and quick. The one criticism that I have is the breakfast. The coffee tasted not as well as in Europe, no fish, the selection for sausages and chees was minimal. the muesli was old. I hope you can do it better.

Reviews.Title: “some positives, many negatives, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Mark Q
Reviews.Content: we paid about $350 (with travel rewards points) for the room, which seemed ridiculous for what we got. the night we spent in the room was the only i have ever spent in dubai, so i don't have anything to compare it to. still it struck me as a v bad value. pros: -they let us check in at about 10am -free lift back to the airport -staff was pretty nice/ pleasant cons: -room reeked of cigarette smoke after requesting a non-smoking room. when i called to complain, they said that it was a non-smoking room (despite having an ash tray and matches on the coffee table). they said they would vacuum the room to get rid of the smell, but did nothing -room was very dated and shabby (probably 2-3 star quality) -bed wasn't totally comfortable -there is nothing of not too close bye adequate factors: -lobby is very ornate, perhaps over the top -breakfast was fine -public transport is about 10 min away

Reviews.Title: “a luxury hotel that is getting old”
Reviews.Author: Mohammad D
Reviews.Content: At the first look, i found Metropolitan palace hotel as a luxury place to stay. This idea stayed with me to the last moment. The only little problem is that the the furniture, bath, gym and jacuzzi are getting old and are needed to be replaced to match a luxury style. I was satisfied with everything specially their kind service.

Reviews.Title: “very good location and servis”
Reviews.Author: ali m
Reviews.Content: the hotel is situated on a very good location in the hear of dubai and maktoum road ,,the servis is very good and prices little bit higher but u wont regret it

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Sumayyah H
Reviews.Content: Great location, Deira, very close to the airport and bargain shopping (Naif Souq, Souq Al Wasl and Al Manaal). Daily shuttle to Deira City Centre. Staff were very helpful. Stunning foyer, spacious bedroom and bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MarkToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located with friendly staff and most of the services expected in a first rate establishment. Except for the lack of free WiFi in the rooms, there were no complaints on our stay in this hotel. We arrived early in the morning and were upgraded to an executive room when the room we booked was not yet ready.

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like Home”
Reviews.Author: miksnjiks
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went for a trip in Dubai and we stayed in Metropolitan Palace Hotel. It is accessible to all major places such as malls, metro train, major roads and other places of interest. Although we were far from home, staying in this hotel feels like I'm home (aside from the reason that there are hotels employees are my countrymen). The employees are hospitable and they really make sure that our needs are given. We felt the warmth of their service and everyone is greeting us and all other guests. The guestrooms are very neat as well as the public area. Given the chance, I will always choose to stay in Metropolitan Palace because of their warmth service and it is a really nice hotel for both business and leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: degalum
Reviews.Content: I was here 3 nights in a executive room,with my son,no have critic to do, except the lack of WiFi in the rooms, and the high prices for the Internet use. Good limousine service.

Reviews.Title: “Marhaba.........”
Reviews.Author: Ahmad A
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel through a travel agent from Bahrain and this hotel was well recommended by them. Since I was with my family and was on holidays I wanted to stay somewhere near the beach front but however looking at the price factor they were bit constraint on my budget and decided to go to this hotel which was on the other side ,Deira. They also have their other hotel in Jumeirah on the beach and they do provide beach access at a very nominal fee which is an added advantage. I was with my wife and 2 kids and had booked for an executive room. Upon check in the manager around showed me the room that I was booked for and also showed me a suite and I decided to go for suite with an additional difference as it was ideal for my family as the room had living room and master bed room and this gave us the additional space required. The executive room offers you a lot of benefits such as breakfast, tea/coffee through out the day and the happy hours in the evening which is a true value for money. Apart from this there are also plenty of supermarkets around for your small needs and commuting is at utmost ease as the metro is just 5 minutes walk away from the hotel. Excellent staff around with seamless service, what else do you need? Great!!!!!!!!! Always look for that Indian Manager around who always has a pleasant smile on his face for any of your needs.

Reviews.Title: “A great value hotel with excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Sarahstealth
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a five night stay and found the hotel to be really good. We received a complimentary upgrade upon arrival which was a pleasant surprise. The restaurants offer good quality food. The best thing about our stay was the staff, they were so helpful. In the bar we were made to feel like really valued customers and the band were brilliant. We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous & Excellent Hotel!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alex F
Reviews.Content: Once I reached the airport as directed by the hotel staff earlier I proceeded to their hospitality desk where I was well received and took me to their shuttle service area. Once I arrived at the hotel it was a very warm welcome by the door man to the reception. Since I was there for more than 2 weeks I requested for a quitter room which was well received by the reception and as preferred by me I was given a non smoking room to. Everyone at the front desk are true professionals and addresses to all your needs. Since I was on a business trip in Deira the hotel catered to all my needs as the hotel is easily commutable to all the shopping areas and the biggest plus point is the Metro Station which is just behind the hotel. They also have a well equipped health club with a roof top swimming pool. All the staffs in the hotel are excellent in what they do and if you’re staying for long time they will also recognize your likes and dislikes. I truly recommend this hotel to everyone staying in Deira and it’s absolutely worth when compared to other hotels around. AF

Reviews.Title: “Excellant stay....”
Reviews.Author: RichardsonW
Reviews.Content: Lately I had been to Dubai, and my agent had booked in a 4* hotel near the city which was not that comfortable and then upon my request moved me to Metropolitan Palace. I was impressed firstly at the reception when I was received with a smile by the lady on the counter...she was beatifull and sweet too. The room was clean and smelling good and as well the restaurants too... being a person much on fb was happy with their Internet and wifi connection in the lounge. The staffs are very friendly and helpfull at all times....impecable.. I would recommend this to my friends and will also stay in this hotel on my next visit...

Reviews.Title: “They couldn't care a less”
Reviews.Author: D00gle
Reviews.Content: Nice Property, clean and tidy, The advice they give to travellers was confusing, the Manager and front Office Supervisor are rude and not prepared to admit they gave incorrect information on airport transport that caused us to miss our flight. They just didn't care. Take you money very quickly. Avoid this place. Spend your money at an establishment that knows what customer service is.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Remk0s
Reviews.Content: We had the hotel during a three night stop over. Everything was just perfect: The room was good, the personel, the pool, the bars and restaurants and the breakfast was awesom. Definitly go there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in crowded Deira”
Reviews.Author: anil d
Reviews.Content: It is denoted as a 5 start hotel on many websites and it certainly is quite good value for money. I was upgraded to the executive floor and also given discount vouchers for breakfast and complimentary airport pick-up and drop, which was very convenient. The staff are very helpful and attentive and are quite well trained. What is very refreshing is they help without expecting tips in return which is unlike many other hotels. The location in Deira is convenient if you want a hotel close to the airport. It is a 20-30 min drive away from the major shopping malls but the Deira city centre is about 10-15 min by taxi. Deira has a number of cheap restaturants so if you are on a budget and dont want to spend money in the hotel, then you will have many options. If you are on business and have meetings on sheikh zayed road or in jumeriah beach area then I would advise leaving a bit early. I only ate twice in the hotel and both times the food quality was average. The vegetable soup in the al-shindagah restaurant in the lobby was extremely disappointing and powdery and felt like it was from a ready-to-cook sachet. The chicken biryani I ordered from room service was slightly better but not by a lot as the chicken felt dry and not well-marinated. The rooms are clean, spacious and well stocked with amenities. Air-conditioning is noiseless. Housekeeping services are top notch. Internet costs 20 dirhams per hour which is a bit steep but the speed is pretty good. Check-in was done in a jiffy. The billing took a while during check-out but that was only because it was being done by a trainee who was still learning the ropes. It was all done with a smile so it was no problem. The decor of the hotel is very emirati in style which is not what everyone prefers.Overall its very good value for money if you want to stay in a lavish hotel but dont want to spend top-dollar on the hotels in jumeirah.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel...lavish and stylish with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Barley77
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for a week in October. The decor was stunning and stylish, the room was very clean...sparkling bathroom, tea and coffee facilities, bottled water replaced daily, flat screen tv and the joy of very quiet and very effective air conditioning. We dined in the hotel restaurants most nights and found the food in each to be of a very high standard with friendly waiting staff and good value for money. The hotel ambience was chic, with a pianist playing in the entrance hall every evening, while there were live bands in the other restaurants after 9pm each night. The roof top pool added another level of enjoyment with warm breezes blowing and a good range of cocktails and beers to keep cool. It was never overly busy and it provided a lovely place to relax. On the day my boyfriend proposed, we enjoyed champagne and another lovely meal at one of the hotel's restaurants where the staff celebrated (soberly) with us. All in all this was a wonderful holiday in spectacular surroundings. We will definitely be back and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Quality”
Reviews.Author: Samm0
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days in this hotel. I was happy with the service. very good location, helpful staff, clean rooms with comfy beds and good price. However, the view from room is really bad, only rooftop of other building. The shower was a little bit smaller than usual.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Joe M
Reviews.Content: Did not know Dubai so it was a flip of a coin, came up trumps. There is something about this hotel that many others should try to do. Everything about the rooms is great, but rooms do not make for a relaxing and welcoming experience, so it is the staff who have developed a style that is natural and comfortable. If you are hesitating about going 5 star then just do it, as this will be better than most other 5 star hotels, even if you pay twice as much, and it beats any 4 star by a mile. Suggest walking the road to the beach, wait till after dark. It is quite safe and goes a bit like a novel as it starts a bit dark and uncertain but then you will find some surprising and interesting sights as you get closer to the coast. Reward yourself with a cold beer at the Hyatt (they don't mind if you are in shorts etc) and then, as a taxi is only a few dollars, catch it back. Food in Metropolitan Palace is as good as anywhere, particularly if you are craving some straight forward but quality food.....go for the the steak.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Molly170656
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online, our choice was decided from previous patrons online comments and the value online deal. All additional costs were explained via email and on arrival (10% service charge & 10% city tax). We had no issues with the hotel, staff, or the restaurants. However, when it came time to settle the bill, our credit was handed over, additional expenses paid, invoice & credit card returned with an additional 20% of the total room rate added (first time mentioned). The invoice was queried; it was stated that this cost was an Internet booking fee? Nobody likes some bodies else’s hand in your wallet, but it’s hard to argue when your airport transport is waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and centrally located business hotel”
Reviews.Author: pjinperth
Reviews.Content: The hotel thankfully lived up to it's online reputation. Nice rooms, restaurants and facilities

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveller05
Reviews.Content: My better half and I stayed here for 4 nights in July 2011. From the outside, the location and exterior of the hotel is below average and certainly not what you'd expect of a 5 star establishment. The lobby redeems the situation somewhat, but is not as splashy as many other more recent hotels in Dubai. Service at the hotel front desk is completely unprofessional if not downright rude. If the hotel management ever look at guest reviews, this is an area of immediate improvement. I must say that our stay was tainted by a totally unhelpful member of staff who refused to consider our floor request and requirements. Guest Relations had to step in and could not do enough to atone for the check-in experience and the should be commended! Meals - Breakfast was nothing to write home about - literally, lacking in real choice. There appeared to be a choice of restaurants at the hotel, but after sampling room service on out first night, we decided to explore the variety and choice in Dubai. Location - do not stay at this hotel if you want to be close to Sheikh Zayed road or Jumeirah. It is located less than a 20 min drive from the airport (about AED30 by taxi, cheaper on the return). The gym is well kitted out. Rooms were adequate- more high end 4 star. Rooms at the back had a horrendous view of a construction site! Overall, we were more impressed by other hotels in Dubai and regretted choosing the Metropolitan Palace. I still struggle to find anything positive about the hotel other than the lobby and the guest relations team.

Reviews.Title: “There are so many hotels in Dubai that are far superior to this one...stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryTraveler_8
Reviews.Content: My very first impression of this hotel was via email, when I made arrangements with a nice hotel staffer to be picked up at the airport by the hotel's shuttle. When I landed, I followed the hotel's instructions and located the area where I was supposed to be met by the shuttle driver. No one was there. I found the hotel's airport hospitality booth and walked in to discuss my dilemma. Well, I learned that despite having provided all my flight details to the hotel to arrange my pick-up, the hotel policy is not to actually send the driver until you check in at the hospitality counter at the airport. This is utterly ridiculous and adds at least another half hour (waiting time) to your trip! For someone who had traveled over 18 hrs already, and given it was already after 9:30pm, this was a huge inconvenience and it also made me angry! Why ask for flight details if you're not going to have your driver be there at the airport to greet your guests? Nonetheless, I was stuck. The hospitality counter worker told me the driver would arrive in 15 min, but that 15 min turned into 25 min and I was still at the airport. I'd finally had enough and told the clerk to try to contact the driver again for an update. Well, turns out he had arrived but was waiting curbside for me and just never bothered to call the clerk to advise her. The clerk at the counter, rightly recognizing my frustration, ended up helping me tote all my bags through the airport, out the exit and across the street where the driver was chatting on his cell phone. Wow. And no apology, nothing, for being late. Later, when we arrived at the hotel, I tried checking in and was told the hotel wanted to bill my credit card up front for my entire stay. What? At that point, I was so exhausted I didn't care but I made it known that this was not normal practice and that it felt insulting to be asked to do this. I went up to my room on the 9th floor and was disappointed. The color scheme was orange and a garish marigold yellow. The bathroom sink, countertop and shower were not very clean. The countertop still had water stains from where someone else's glass had left a mark. The shower had hair in it. When I finally went to bed, thinking at this point that nothing more could go wrong, I was shocked to discover the bed mattress (if you can call it that) must have been made of steel. It was the hardest, most unforgiving, most uncomfortable bed I have ever "slept" in. I say "slept" because I was unable to get comfortable, tossed and turned all night and woke up sore. By the way, my "view" from this executive club room was atrocious...nothing but old, worn buildings as far as I could see. Trying to give the hotel another chance the next morning, I got up and went to the "club" floor to have breakfast. It was deserted. The waiter working there noted it would be better to go to the main dining area to eat because there was a better selection there (the club level had only cold cereal and juice available because...no one usually ate there...gee, wonder why!). He then offered for me to stay in the club area and that he could go down to the lobby area restaurant to make a plate for me. Not knowing what was offered for breakfast plus finding the request nice but weird, I grudgingly went to the main area to eat. This area was nice but not nearly as quiet or private as I would have liked (and as the club area was). Nonetheless, breakfast was decent and the staff there was nice. In addition to above and the generally, overall unpleasantness of the hotel, I also encountered problems with the level of noise at night on my floor as well as with the hotel's internet service. First of all, the noise...I stayed 4 nights here. On 3 nights, after 10:30pm, inexplicably, the hotel maintenance crew would work on my floor. Between their loud conversations and banging noises (coupled with the already totally unsleepable bed noted above), I was unable to fall asleep. Each night I probably called the front desk 2-3 times to beg them to help and to have their workers do their work at more reasonable hours. The staff always said they would take care of it but the noise lasted at least an hour each night. Completely unacceptable! Second...internet service..for USD 20 per day, you would expect fast and consistent service. Um, no. The hotel's server or network kept going down for hours at a time. This happened on two days. I asked why this wasn't fixed/addressed as guests were being charged a lot of money each day for a service which, essentially, the hotel was not providing. I got no response to this. Overall, I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. There are hundreds of hotels in Dubai. Stay elsewhere. Oh, and to say this is a 5-star hotel is completely laughable. I'd rate it a 2 star. It was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “So Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Luv2eatsushi
Reviews.Content: This is an older property (compared to brand new hotels in the city) that is well priced, well appointed, comfortable, clean and the staff is great.

Reviews.Title: “Empty and soul-less. Not a 5* Experience”
Reviews.Author: rayfu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends (all of whom quite liked it). I didnt. While close to the quality of a European 4-star business hotel, its a little plastic and suffers from a poor location with respect to other Deira hotels. The staff are quite cold and unhelpful. The rooftop pool is tiny. Prices for drink and food are extortionate ( the cheapest item on the room service menu is a bland chicken burger for £12GBP) Also a negative, the bar is hosted by some poor Karaoke artists and frequented by 'single' Eastern-European ladies and their Arab admirers. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: alfaetrin
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fairly central, although Dubai is such a big city that few of the attractions are really within walking distance of each other. Still, taxis are plentiful, cheap and metered, so transport is no problem. The reception area of the hotel is very bright and pleasant, and the desk staff are extremely helpful. Our room was very spacious and comfortable, with adjustable air conditioning and all the amenities you would need. As with all Dubai hotels, the restaurant here was nice but extremely expensive, so we didn't use it for breakfast. At the moment they are running one good dinner offer of steak and lobster in one of their restaurants, so we had this on one day, and it was certainly most enjoyable. For most meals, though, we followed recommendations from other TripAdvisor contributors, and weren't disappointed. Must-sees in Dubai include the "At The Top" experience at the Burj Khalifa tower (you must pre-book, or pay four times as much at the door), the dancing fountain at the Dubai Mall, a Dubai city tour and a Dhow evening cruise with dinner. Dubai is a modern, cosmopolitan and crowded city, and a trip out to the desert, either to the east coast or to Al Ain, are great ways of seeing more of the country. These trips also show the extreme contrasts between urban Dubai with its modern skyscrapers and the rest of the country. The winter months are certainly the best time to visit Dubai, as the weather is warm and pleasant through the day. During the summer, the extreme heat would make it quite unpleasant to stay outside for any length of time. When we visited (February), the temperature was a very pleasant 20 or 21 degrees or so through the day, although sweaters or a jacket were needed in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a five star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: acepower84
Reviews.Content: I booked my honeymoon for Dubai and decided to pick the Metropolitan Palace with LetsGo2 Travel. It was my first holiday experience in another country as i have only travelled in the UK and India. The staff were very good, provided us with whatever we needed and the buffet breakfasts in the morning were excellent. There were 2 lifts in the building which were always available. Room service and cleaning were good too, although sometimes you have to remind them to clean the room. Very cool in the hotel, especially when it is vigorously hot outside. I would recommend people to go there as you can have a nice chill out session and you are also very close to all the ammenities nearby. I would definitely go again, they even sent a cake to our room as we had just got married, free of charge

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: JontravellerSydney
Reviews.Content: We booked this place as it looked good from their web site - but do not be fooled its not. There are far better alternatives in better locations in Dubai We checked in very late at night extremely tired from our flight. The room we were checked into had had drainage water leaking up through the bath room floor - quite probably from the toilet - most disturbing and possibly a health hazard The front desk kindly agreed to change our room to a better one, but this was a smoking room (only one available) and I am allergic to smoke! The delay and aggravation was a nuisance, the room and the hotel itself had an unpleasant odour from stale smoke, not a good night The next day front desk changed our room to no smoking - but this time water was leaking into the room from the ceiling - outside the bathroom! We alerted reception and a plumber did come in to fix this in due course , but again disruption and we were left with a wet floor This last room was very noisy with constant very loud drone from the air-conditioning units (it was on the 10th floor) and neither of us got a good nights' sleep There is a pool on the top floor - no bad, but the spa is very poor. The Palace has a sister hotel near the beach and they advertise shuttle transfers. When we asked to go there in the early evening so we could use the facilities, it turns out the only shuttle was in the morning, so we did not go! Also its around 30 minutes away so far from convenient. The hotel was quite full of contractors on their way back and forth to Afghanistan - I suspect this keeps occupancy up and standards have slipped. Breakfast was adequate but not up to standard of a 5 star hotel - if you want a good breakfast try the Crowne Plaza at Yas Island! The staff were helpful and tried their best to help but our experience at this hotel was very much 1 star not 5! I have written to the hotel complaining about our experience but as expected no reply

Reviews.Title: “Previously excellent, now good”
Reviews.Author: explore_&_indulge
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel a few times over the past few years for short stop overs in Dubai. This is a plush, comfortable hotel with large, well appointed rooms, altho air con is set on arctic temperature (as with most of Dubai) and cannot be changed. On this last visit we noticed very few travellers whereas in previous years the hotel has been quite busy (altho this seems to reflect Dubai generally this year). Accordingly the hotel buffet breakfast has been scaled back significantly (altho still a large selection - it is the arabic breakfast items that mostly seem missing) and does not seem as fresh or appetising as before. This is a hotel that you will need transport to visit the beach, gold souk and shopping centres. Upside is that main road to hotel was free flowing this time and not subject to traffic jams as in previous years. Also there are now more courtesy buses to various shopping centres - reception staff can provide pick up schedules. The new metro line also has a station nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & value”
Reviews.Author: GulfTiger
Reviews.Content: The customer service was excellent, especially of the room service. the swimming pool on the roof was clean and the staff were also very good. very clean and convienient to shops. hotel contains two clubs and a large restaurant. also has executive suites. also a very good fitness and massage centre.

Reviews.Title: “HAD THE BEST 18th EVER! GREAT HOTEL REALLY RECOMMEND!”
Reviews.Author: Shy16
Reviews.Content: I went Dubai for My 18th for a week it really was a great experience, we had loads to do everyday and coming back to this hotel after each days wonderful experience really made the whole trip an even bigger luxury! The staff were absolutely great, decorating my hotel room on my birthday and giving me a cake and card, I had 4 birthday cakes that day! I went with my sister, My mum and dad. My dad is on a wheelchair and the hotel was quite good in helping my dad out. The guards at the door always helped my dad in and out and the staff provided a perfect room for wheelchair acess. The only problem was the few steps at the entrance of the hotels restaraunt, but despite that the staff always lifted my dads wheelchair into the restaraunt everyday! They were so helpful! This was a great hotel and i really recommend it to anyone travelling to dubai, it is quite a bit away from the attractions of dubai but that can all easily be sorted with a personal taxi and it is definatly worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blasterrr
Reviews.Content: Metropolitan Palace is a beautifully designed hotel. Looking at the building from outside one cant tell if its a 5 star or not. Room had a very nice and comfortable bed. Overlooking the road. Hotel does not have any balconies attached to the rooms. Overall service was pretty good. Our checkout took longer than expected because the hotel has to check the Minibar and the items used. Be aware that it is not a smart idea to be tapping into the minibar since it is Very Very Expensive. We ended up paying close to 70 dollars just for using some water and juices. There are few restaurants nearby where you can eat. Hotel sits in the center of Dubai and one can decide which way you want to go, be it West or East.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable but chaotic - not quite a 5* experience”
Reviews.Author: Puddin_lover_10
Reviews.Content: Our experience of the Metropolitan Palace was mixed, reflecting the service we received. Upon arrival at 8am after a gruelling overnight flight we were told that our room wasn't available until 2 unless we wanted to pay more - fairly standard - however our bags had already been whisked away. We were left shatered and jet-lagged to our own devises and not offered any refreshments. Reception then told us we could check in at 11am after all. So after wondering the streets for a few hours we returned at 11 to be told by reception that our room had been ready for an hour which miffed us given that we'd been clock watching for the last few hours. Our room was a bit problematic -a smoking room when we'd requested non-smoking. The curtains didn't shut properly and the do not disturb switch didn't work. This resulted in fawlty towers-esque farce as we were disturbed on numerous occassions by (very nice) staff wanting to turn the bed down, deliver us fruit, etc when all we wanted was to get a few hours kip. We asked reception if they could sort out the problems and they decided that we should move rooms. This turned into another farce as the porters did not turn up as promised. After waiting 20 minutes we ended up going back down to reception and finally the porters were dispatched but it took about an hour to move rooms when we would have been quite happy to move ourselves and get on with our holiday! On departure we ended up accidentally getting an unregistered taxi because the door staff were too busy faffing about with a coach party who had just arrived. On the plus side, the hotel is close to the airport and the tube station. The bar staff at the open top bar at the top of the hotel were excellent with brilliant advice and recommendations and the small swiming pool and single sex sauna/jacussi/steam room were very nice. The english bar inside the hotel was ok but subject to random elitism. We were told on several occassions that the nicest tables were reserved and noted that these were never occupied which simply seemed a bit daft. You should also note that there is not much outside the immediate vicinity of the hotel which is in a financial district so choice of restaurants & bars etc. is limited unless you want to get a taxi. In conclusion, the Metropolitan Palace has 5* aspirations but in the main bumbling inefficient staff who appeared unable to do more than one thing at a time or anything in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but food/drink silly prices.”
Reviews.Author: NeilandBarbara
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in March on our way back from Cambodia/Thailand, to break up the journey and for Barbara to replace a diamond earring she had lost. Officially rated 5* and I'd say that was fair overall. Well located near the Creek in the Deira area.10 min cab ride from the airport. We arrived at 02.00 in the morning from Bangkok aboard the new A380 800 Super-jumbo very quiet, almost silent plane - nice. No problem with hotel check in at this late hour. Very polite and efficient lobby and reception staff. We were in our room fast. The hotel has 11 floors. 1 - reception, a restaurant, a few shops etc. Mezzanine floor and 1st floor - more restaurants and conference facilities. 2-7 are standard rooms. 8-10 are executive rooms with their own lounge. 11 is the pool and gym. 4 lifts. Room was a reasonable size. Flat screen TV, plenty of storage space. Fridge with drinks. Silly, silly prices even for a hotel minibar. Nice large and comfy bed. Fruit in room. Free water. Good, well equipped bathroom. Only one robe!! In room safe was operated by a credit card. The digital ones are better. With this type of safe, you have to keep a credit card on you at all times to open it, when often you want the card in the safe!! Defeats the object really. Though better than nothing. Turn down service with nice chocolates. Hair dryer, but no iron. Nice, though fairly small pool. Good padded loungers. towels available at gym reception. The area has a small bar and snack bar. All very clean and tidy, with 2 attendants looking after you. The gym was well equipped with plenty of TV's to keep boredom at bay. Separate rooms for male & female for steam room, sauna, hot tub, Made the mistake of ordering 2 small beers - over 60d. Breakfast was excellent with a very good selection of everything you could think of. If you want to buy food/groceries etc, there is a small supermarket behind the hotel. Go to the lobby and go past the hairdressers and out the rear entrance. Supermarket is opposite. We did not eat in the hotel in the evening. The hotel restaurants were empty. Again silly prices. Directly opposite the entrance, across the road is a very nice Egyptian restaurant. Huge portions. Great mezzas and kebabs. downstairs a cafe, upstairs a bit more formal. Very busy with a nice atmosphere. Plenty of other restaurants in the streets behind the hotel. Head towards the new IBIS hotel, or past the Taj. We tried Lebanese and Iranian. All very good and at reasonable prices. We took a cab on day to the recently opened Burj Kalifa tower. Not really open yet and the viewing gallery is closed (currently indefinitely). Not to worry, still massively impressive building. Go at night when the musical dancing fountains are running (Bellagio style) - great fun and very impressive. A new show every 20 min and free. We had a lovely meal overlooking the Burj. This will become the main tourist area of Dubai without doubt. Lots of chic restaurants. A stunning area. Dubai does not have much to offer a repeat visitor, apart from its location to break up a long haul journey and its winter climate. I was expecting to be bored after Cambodia & Thailand, but we had a fine 4 nights here. Hotel was what we expected for a 5* in Dubai. Very plush with good service. The location is fine if you don't want to be out at the beach. We've done that and your just too far away. You can walk to the Creek in 2 minutes and there are lots of restaurants nearby. It did what we wanted, but the food and drink prices were laughable. You can use the groups sister hotel on the beach for a fee. Daily shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Hats off to Habtoor”
Reviews.Author: CTontour
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is part of the Habtoor Group and wherever they they get their staff from or whoever trains them - congratulations. Restaurants and bars great (like many other hotels there may be 'ladies of the night! but not a problem and you don't have to play!) Rooftop pool is small, but often you are alone out there. Great for sunning and relaxing. Rooms very well serviced (turn down service as a matter of course). Good central location, famlies welcome. Not full 5*, but very good 4* plus. Taxis no problem and cheap (even limos not too expensive, agree price with driver before travelling). Grab a day or two at the sister hotel on Jumeira Beach for about £20 inc. transfers, best of both world's.

Reviews.Title: “winter sun”
Reviews.Author: jmenzies
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a split holiday for 4 nights. The hotel was lovely , the only problem we had was that there was a party going on above us and carried on until approx. 6am on newyears day, I don't have a problem with celebrations at this time of year but felt that i shouldnt have to complain twice before the music was turned off. Eventually on day two we were moved to a suite which was lovely, so word of warning if staying at new year make sure your not on floor 2 or 8 as the presidental suite is on the ninth floor. Overall the hotel was good and well situated with in deira. We have stayed in Dubai before and would say don't be put off by my comments as the hotel is fine to stay in and most of the staff are lovely especially Christine on reception who helped solve our problem.

Reviews.Title: “Happy New Year”
Reviews.Author: obx-folks
Reviews.Content: I arrived 31 December and the staff was professional and attentive. The mood was lite as it was New Years Eve. The room was clean and everything was in fine working order. Nothing bad about the hotel but bad luck for me was that I stayed in room 203 which is directly above the bar. Being New Years Eve, they partied hard. If you are bothered by loud music, don't stay in rooms 200 throough 206. This is nothing against the hotel. Nice pool. Breakfast was fine. Check out was as expected and the shuttle was ontime and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for short stopover”
Reviews.Author: Jo8e
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days on the way back from Sri lanka. The hotel met all our requirements and was nice and relaxing. Room was a good size and was brought a small basket of fruit on the day we arrived. We ate in one of there restaurants and was very reasonally priced. Our stay included breakfast and there are plenty of things to choose from. We also used the roof top pool and as expected if you want to use the jacuzzi and steam rooms they are seperate for men and women. From the hotel you can walk to the creek area in about 10-15 minutes. Dubai has so much to see and as we only had 2 half days and one full day I had already planned trips via a local company "North Tours". We did a half day city tour and then a desset safari, which also included dune bashing and a BBQ in a camp and belly dancing etc. Both were very good and very reasonably priced and with only a short time in Dubai they were a good choice. I'm glad I had done some research upfront as prices varied quite a bit with other companies. I would definatley go back to Dubai and use this hotel but next time spend a bit longer there so that i can explore alot more.

Reviews.Title: “Zum relaxen - na ja”
Reviews.Author: HeikeD
Reviews.Content: Did it not so via the internet with direct bookings ... almost 1 hours needed to find our reservation, but the money was already charged for the room reservation. Even otherwise, the service ran to be desired. Beautiful, however, was the birthday cake in the room. Conclusion: Price - Performance does not correspond to 100% If, however, relatively central location - near clock tower - and for 1 to 2 days, it is ok impertinent: 2 hr internet 10 euros for the whole day and 20 euros in modern times. But there´s right next door to a small restaurant with internet for 3 euros / 2 hours and you cold have as much coffee as you like ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MalteserIreland
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say??I was one of them people who actually had doubts about this hotel due to some complains I read before I went there. but can I say something? I actually couldn't find anything to complain about in this hotel!! Amazing Hotel ,Faboulous location, Friendly and professional staff. rooms are quite big, clean and spacious. Pool on the 13th floor did the job...not crowded either..............And if you go here please look for a waiter called Benjamin he normally works by the pool,brillaint worker who helped me with anything i asked for.from purchasing Gold Diamonds to restaurants and tours:) Dubai itself is just amazing!!!! definitely go back sometime:)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Dubai Stopover!! Thoroughly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: mrskrska33
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on route Auckland to UK - after having terrible experience at the Hilton Jumeriah Beach on the way out. What a difference!! Friendly staff - who couldn't do enough - small but quiet rooftop pool, great hotel restaurants - fab rooms & hotel decor, and very reasonable room rates including breakfast buffet. This hotel is 7 minute taxi from airport and walking distance (2 x blocks behind hotel) to local restaurants, shops & cafes. Having been a Hilton customer for years (not any more though, after this trip) I intend to use this hotel every time I'm in Dubai!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: Sheshy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night break at the Metropolitan Palace Hotel and it truly was amazing. We read other reviews and decided to book an Executive Room. Initially it bumped up our holiday price but was well worth it and recommend anyone to do this. The upgrade included a full buffet breakfast served either in the Executive Lounge or the Al Shindagah Restaurant, transfers from and to the airport, complimentary soft drink, tea and coffee and exclusive use of the Executive Lounge with complimentary cocktail hour from 6.30pm to 9.30pm. We were met at the airport and taken to the hotels own airport lounge, where we were served drinks while we waited for our transfer. Check in with quick and courteous. The room was beautiful and was cleaned twice a day, the enormous bed was really comfortable with feather duvets and pillow's, which was changed daily. As were the towels, bath robes. Slippers, fruit basket and bottled water. The mini bar in the room was expensive, however this true of all hotel mini bars. The hotel service was beyond compare. The butler, yes butler on the executive floor called daily to see if our room was cleaned to our satisfaction. During cocktail hour, he served us both hot and cold canapés. On the second night he ran our of Heineken, my husbands preferred drink. He apologised profusely and made sure the bar was fully stocked with Heineken for the following evening. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the hotel staff. We ate in two of the hotels restaurants. The food was fantastic and we thought reasonably priced. Of course you can eat far cheaper outside of the hotel as they are many restaurants in the Deira areas. The rooftop pool was lovely but we didn't buy drinks from the bar we bought the water up from our room and just got glasses of ice. When your around the pool in the day time they bring you iced flannels which was very nice given that it was 40 degrees most days. In the evening after cocktail hour we drank in the Sketch Bar this is the only bar for smokers in the hotel. The hotel staff are all so helpful and nothing is a problem, keeping the customer happy really is their number one priority. An experience not to be missed is the Arabian Evening Safari, which included 4 x 4 dune bashing, quad bikes, camel riding, BBQ at a Bedouin camp and Arabic entertainment. We booked this through the concierge at hotel which cost 250 AED each. The only negative about this is that the hotel charged 10% for booking trips if you paid for the excursion by credit card, so paying by cash is the best option. I would highly recommend taking the Big Bus Tour as it takes you around all the major sights and you can hop on and off the bus at your leisure. Overall we had an amazing time and would love to thank all the staff at the Metropolitan Palace Hotel for making our trip so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice, psuedo-deluxe hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcb193
Reviews.Content: Dubai has a lot of capacity right now, so finding a great deal is not hard. This hotel is very nice, but maybe a little over-stated on tripadvisor. Pros: - Deluxe hotel - Nice rooms, good amenities - Rooftop Pool - Good, helpful Staff - Decent walking around area (15min walk to Gold souq) - Close to airport Cons- - On the other side of Dubai (deira district), so getting to the sites might involve taxis or buses. - Not hip, or trendy, or overely exciting, though very well decorated and deluxe - No room internet

Reviews.Title: “Metropolitan Palace Dubai-Worst Hotel experienace everi”
Reviews.Author: nmcldn
Reviews.Content: We booked through SkyTravel in SW London for two adults and 1 child being 14 years. We were given a vouchers which stated bed and breakfast for three named indivduals as adults. Upon arrival at 1am we were told that the third person was informed as child of 10 years and not an adult. The manager was arguing we have to pay extra as the room booked had only one king bed. We were at the checking for more than an hour. We should have been given the extra bed as complimentry. The manager did not want to admit that this was a hotel management fault and should have worked this out with the travel sites they do business with. We were than told by the manager that he'll put the bed as complimentry. During our stay we were treated very poorly when we asked for basic like tea cups, ironing board, kettle which one expect to have as a 5 star hotel they claim it to be. To our surprise when we checked out after 6 nights we were demanded to for the extra bed for 7 nights which we were unable to understand. The manager did not want to come out to the reception to deal with our enquiry instead the receptionist called him . We highly recommend NOT to come to Metropolitan Palace and instead consider Renaissance which we stayed at previous year and had splendid time.

Reviews.Title: “Wishes it was a five-star...”
Reviews.Author: Dubaiisgaudy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Four-Points in Bur Dubai on my way to Africa and this hotel does not even compare! First, we booked through Travelocity. We did not try to hide the fact that we were a four person family looking for one room, but the management treated us this way upon arrival; check-in was more than an hour! The manager was arguing that 4 people could not stay in one room, when he should have been offering us a complimentary upgrade! He did not want to admit that this was hotel managment's fault. The management should have worked this policy out with all travel sites it does business through, not blame us and make us wait for our room at 2 a.m. in the morning for more than an hour! It was not our fault-we input everthing into the computer and it gave us this room option. The room was booked for under $100 dollars and they wanted to charge us $400 for two rooms. The room we got was tiny, no complimentary upgrade considering our situation. Any other hotel in any other place in the world would have given us a bigger room for free, but not it Dubai and certainly not the MP! On our way out we asked for a van taxi, instead we were escorted to an illegal unmarked taxi. Luckily the guy did not try to rip us off, per Dubai law if you get into an unmarked taxi and a dispute erupts the police cannot get involved-caveat emptor! Other annyoances: We asked for four clean towels got two! No cordless kettle, no free wi-fi: these are things we have come to expect from 3 star hotels like the Best Western, but the MP bill themselves as a five-star, shouldn't these things be included? This is the bottom line if a hotel bills itself as a five-star hotel: all the rooms, no matter what price you paid for them, should include five-star service, this hotel does not prescibe to that philosophy. I'm sure if you get the most expensive rooms you will have five-star service, but if you're looking to save a little money, but still get good service do not come here go to the Sheraton Four Points in Bur Dubai!

Reviews.Title: “Happy 4* Struggling 5*”
Reviews.Author: E-Trip11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Met Palace between 16th 21st April 2009. From the airport it took only 10 minutes to get to the hotel, taxi price £1.80 (bargin) The hotel itself is located mid shops and business and isnt obvious from the road. The entrance is pretty grand and the staff are very friendly, i have read reviews about poor arrogant service, they were superb providing regular check ups, room cleaning twice daily (closing curtains for you at night) and newspapers iron/board when i needed. The hotel has nice pool on the roof which is tad small but def does the job, there is a gym with running machine, weights, spa bath and sauna.I didnt have any meals included but thanks to reading reviews of this hotel i walked 100yrs to the left of hotel and bought tonnes of stuf for breakfast from a local supermarket for no more than £7 that last nearly the full 5 days, be aware the hotel charges £10 just for breakfast thats everyday! The rooms are decent size nice bathrooms and quiet, i got decent sleep on the 5th floor. The hotel is only 5 min walk from the Dubai creek and a water bus gets you across the water to the sooks (a must see) if your going by taxi anywhere always get taxis with cream bodies some have red or green roofs the hotel taxi is a bit pricey, forget buses they are almot none existant . The price to Jumeriah beach by taxi was 30 dirhams or £6 the journey time is 20mins i would advise the Jumeriah beach park as this is suitable for tourist s who want to show a bit of skin, be warned the migrant workers will stop there JCB's, cranes, to look at women and at one point my partner was being watched by 30+ men whos mind dont need reading lol bizzare. Dont waste anytime in Dubai every minute should be used to explore this wonderful magical place. If you like a drink get ready the average price is £7 a pint ... enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: kittenne
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week's break in Dubai, and we stayed at the Metropolitan Palace for 7 nights. I will admit I was a bit worried about the choice of hotel having read some of the reviews on this site, but I can honestly say we had a great experience and would definitely return to this hotel if we go back to Dubai. Even though we arrived at the hotel at 9am after travelling overnight they let us check into our room an hour later, and on departure day let us keep our room for two extra hours as our flight wasn't until late afternoon for no extra charge. The staff were very friendly and attentive - my only criticism was that some of them had very limited English which made being understood quite difficult at times (there was a function at the hotel one night and we could hear the music in our room, we rang down to complain but no-one understood what we were saying!) The rooftop pool was gorgeous and never too busy - we always managed to get a sun-lounger. Breakfast was great - a good selection of food, but we didn't eat any other meals in the hotel. I used the gym several times and was impressed - much better and bigger than a normal hotel gym and again never too busy. It is in the north end of Dubai, i.e "old town" Dubai so yes it isn't as plush as say staying around the marina or Jumeirah Beach, but it is a fraction of the price of some of those hotels, and a very easy taxi ride from wherever you want to go. One night we took a cab to Atlantis on The Palm island - it took 20 minutes and cost about £10 - and that is literally the other end of the city. The decor and rooms are looking a little dated now (again compared to some of the other true luxury hotels in Dubai) but if you are looking to stay in Dubai without spending thousands then the Metropolitan Palace is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: slowcoachme
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week in MPH. This is definately not a 5 star hotel by Dubai standards, more like a 3-4. On checking in I was asked upfront for 2000 dh, "to cover incidentals" I gave my credit card which then had 2000 dh taken from it and now wait for it to be put back on, as I paid for everything upfront and didnt use minibar etc. It is staffed by Philippino and Indian staff who were very friendly. The buffet breakfast was pretty standard, without any variation. The decor is dark and dated, and there should be more seating in lobby area. There is no snack or coffee bar, only expensive restaurants. The location is good, just a short walk to the creek. There is a store at the back of the hotel, buy anything you need from there, tin of coke is 1dh, room service tin of coke 17dh!! Most of the other guests were Iranian and I saw them coming back at night with bags full of takeaway food!! The pool area on roof is small but OK, and wasnt crowded. There is no tea or coffee making stuff in the room, no kettle either. The City Center Mall is nearby and they send a minibus to the hotel to take you there, a bit cramped but saves on taxi fares. If you want a drink, go to the Irish Village, has a pub like atmosphere and you dont have to buy food. Went on the Big Bus tour with a BOGOF voucher, and did the blue route, it was Ok but more like a tour of the shopping malls of Dubai. The malls have a good choice of food for cheap eats. We had a good Arabic meal at Automatic restaurant in Al Rigga St.

Reviews.Title: “Just back from Metropolitan Palace”
Reviews.Author: travelbug16
Reviews.Content: Loved it for a short -5day - break. In the city, and excellent for shopping -we had half-board, and would probably not do that again , but for our 1st visit to Dubai and having heard al the stories about how expensive it is to eat out, we thought we'd go half-board. However, the shopping malls are fabulous for any kind of food you can imagine, suchi, italian, chinese etc - and about the price you would pay in UK. We went to the beach via the transfer service to the sister hotel Al-Habtoor Hotel at Jumeriah beach - fantastic !!! Use of all the facilities for a small fee.... Don't forget to visit Al Karama for the markets - great bargains there.. can't wait to go back !!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing comes to mind”
Reviews.Author: Mustafa87
Reviews.Content: Ok well - I came to this hotel at a decent price since we were sharing a room (much cheaper that way!) - I'll be honest, it was a not-so-good start - since the cheeky sods at lastminute.com decided to remove the additional 'free hot buffet breakfast' offer at of course, the last minute. I was too busy to notice since I had booked the holiday then went straight back to the library to study for exams - although finding out at like midnight, after a 7 hour flight isn't the best thing, but we got over this. The room was really good - although of course this was my first stay in Dubai ever - the beds were spacious, bathroom was clean and organised, we had a room right at the end so it was definitely quiet, the view from our room wasn't the best but we could still see the marina and some other parts that weren't covered by other massive buildings! Breakfast served (when we paid for it one day) was excellent, loads to choose from hot and cold - other days we just waited till lunchtime and had a big meal (thank you hardees! :P) The location is decent - its around 15-20 mins drive from the airport I remember. To be honest I'd recommend renting a car - we decided to do this after waiting 2 hours for a taxi, and instead of going to our original location we thought we'd go to the airport and get a car - made the trip MUCH better since we had the freedom to pretty much go anywhere - we even drove to abu dhabi and back one night. The hotel run a free valet parking service which made this even more useful, and the renting rates are pretty affordable. (By the way if getting car rental from the airport - make sure you do so upon arrival, apparently the only way to get to the car rental shops is when you've just arrived in the airport, which is silly - we cheekily sneaked past security through the exits to get in, they saw us, shouted at us as we walked away, then just turned around! lol...) What else - ah yeh the staff were ok-ish, to be honest having read other reviews here I'm surprised - but then again I may have gone at a lower-profile time where things were more relaxed. We didn't bother going to the restaurant as we thought it was quite expensive. Altogether the staff were good and responsive - service provided and help provided were good - not excellent (could've provided better maps! We searched high and low for a map and ended up still having to use the one the hotel gave us... Ah well.) I'd recommend this for first-timers in Dubai, my next hotel in Dubai will definitely be Jumeirah beach! For sharwarma lovers if you wander around the back areas of the hotel - ther's a few cafes which do it for like, 3/4 Dh! Thats 50p! And they still taste brilliant Eat your heart out edgware road :P Also there's a cool swimming pool on the roof with a jacuzzi, as well as a gym, steam room and sauna if I'm not mistaken, all were pretty good - the gym only really has a decent weights area, the rest is pretty standard Check it out, if its your first time. And rent a car - much better than haggling with a taxi driver or going on some ridiculously longer route and having no idea you're being charged double what you shoudl be.

Reviews.Title: “Good city hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tillgofred
Reviews.Content: the metropolitan palace hotel is a good choice if u want to "shop till u drop" <) it is near the big malls and restaurants. most of the guests seemed to be buisness guys. the staff was great, always a smile on their face and everytime ready to manage your problems or wishes. but if u want a beachholiday, you have to choose another hotel because u need to go 20 min by taxi to the beach. the DUBAITAXIs are very cheap, to the beach it costs about 25dhs which is about 7euro. in the end it is a good hotel for citytravellers.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Good Value,Comfortable Room.”
Reviews.Author: DENTISTJEM
Reviews.Content: This was a 1 week half term trip with my husband and 14 year old daughter. Having read reviews on trip advisor, the first thing we did when we checked in, was to upgrade the room.For an extra £100 per night, we had a junior suite- 2 rooms. The package then included all our alcoholic beverages in the evening, afternoon tea with cakes etc from 3 pm and canapes in the evening. This made it extremely good value as there were 3 of us and soft drinks were also free between 6.30 and 9pm. As 1 glass of wine is about £9 and a coke £4 we felt this deal was extremely good value.Location of hotel was fine. Yellow Dubai taxis are so cheap that we felt it was better to stay where we did ( much cheaper than Jumeirah area) and taxi in as and when.Dubai is very expensive to eat out, so be prepared!!Swimming pool on roof top was lovely. We didn't bother going to the sister hotel on the beach as this would have cost approx.£50- we were very happy by the pool.Best of holiday- the room and the deal that came with it. Least-expense of drinks etc

Reviews.Title: “great clean , central hotel & 5 star service.”
Reviews.Author: londonbabe73
Reviews.Content: Just back from the metropolitan palace this week . Great experience no probs or safety issues ( please dont get confused with the metropolitan hotel) , approx 15 mins from the airport , about 15 dirams ( get dubai taxi beige cars). had a room on the 6th floor , decent size pool and steam room etc and gym on the roof. Room was large clean and had separate bath/ shower , mini bar ( didnt use it) but no tea coffee facilites but they will bring you a pot of hot water for free if you need that coffee in the morning bring your own. staff went out of their way to help you from the reception to the maid, didn't eat in the hotel there are 2 supermarkets within 5 mins of the hotel so popped in for some munchies and put cokes in the mini bar fridge and no-one seeemed to mind. they have all the famous brands of drink crisps choclate etc as well as backery for breakfast snacks. approx 50 dirams cab ride away from jumeriah beach area , takes around 30 mins , so very central for the creek etc . Insist on a dubai taxi when going out from the hotel they are a fraction of the "executive" cars. Only niggle was that the hotel wanted 120 dirams each to use the beach sister hotel facilities ( approx £25) which i thought was a total rip off, ask the taxi to take you the jumeriah beach park , on the jumeriah beach with beach chairs etc for hire without the big tourist prices with couple of reasonable cafe's beach bar which is where the locals go at 5 dirams each and it's lovely give the hotel beaches a miss and save cash. Also short walk from the creek approx 10 mins flag down an abra for 1 diram each to cross the creek to bur dubai great cheap experience . booked thru expedia for £120 per nite room only breakfast wasn't included for that rate and the hotel price of £16 each was a bit steep so walked to local cafe's nearby for a fraction of the price. If your looking to do more than fry on the beach for the week and want to get out and about as well as seeing the sights this is a perfect hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend upgrade to EXecutive Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Hunterstrystjambo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location around15 minutes from airport and short walk to the creek and not far from the souks of Deira. Having spoken to friends and colleagues as well as researched trip advisor strongly advised to upgrade to Executive rooms. Most importantly this included happy hour between 6.30 and 9pm and hot canapes and soup. Happy hour was free alcohol which is a real bonus where drink is extremely expensive( My wife was charged £15 for a glass of wine at the Emirated Towers VU bar!) also package included breakfast, afternoon tea, coffee and soft drinks 24/7 and free airport transfers. The seperate lounge was quite quiet but the extremely helpful staff treated us fantastically well. Even ordered chardonnay specially for my wife after she had mentioned that it was her favourite. Rooms were comfortable and staff constantly checked to make sure we had everything. Roof top pool was good and there was also a jacuzzi and steam room. Only complaints were staff member ordered us a taxi without a meter which cost us double . Always insist on metered taxis. Secondly on check out reception insisted we had used a can of pepsi from the mini bar. I explained we had not used the mini bar and in any event soft drinks were free. However he insisted that if we didn`t pay the staff would have to!! £4 lighter and more importantly an excellent experience spoiled in the last few minutesof a 6 day trip. Hotel also offers complimentary shuttle bus to sister hotel with a minimal charge to use facilities but this worked out at £25 each! Excellent value apart from charge to access beach, staff in executive lounge were fantastic and great city centre location

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: haconstruct
Reviews.Content: This a great & true 5 star hotel. I had a room on the 8th floor behind elevators and it was totally quiet. Hotel has three atriums, each different but nice. In eve, lobby has a violin and grand piano played by two young women. Service was excellant, pool on roof quiet and not crowded. Taxis were available all the time, and usually less than a 5 minute wait. Lots of resturants within waling distance, and a grocey store only a couple of blocks away. Absolutely no compaints. Rate thru Kayak USD135/night,

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Erhan-erco
Reviews.Content: I had buiseness meetings in Deira so I booked this nice hotel for ten days. The quality of the otel and the service is above the average of the surrounding hotels. its close to the main meeting points and friendly people are ready to help you.

Reviews.Title: “comment”
Reviews.Author: richthofen
Reviews.Content: decoration is very good.the overall appearance.service is prompt.food is good.only problem i have experience is that with the room temperature control.room is cold most of the time even after correcting with the temperature controller.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: joemal9
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel theystaff could not do enough for you. The location was great but if you want to be near a beach you need to book some where else,but saying that taxi's are very very cheap. Hotel was a great location not far from Dubai city centre (Deira) which has a good shopping centre. The people are very pleasent and you are treated like a member of the royal family. I would book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Experience of a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: Roslyn29
Reviews.Content: What can i say, loved this hotel. Complete luxury, we had a deluxe room on a B&B basis. I could not falt the hotel/holiday in any way from the flight to transfer- hotel. Breakfast was amazing and the service from the staff was 1st class. Alcohol was expensive but this is common in Dubai. Ate in the hotel a couple of nights, but mainly in other hotels as we were out and about. Best meal had to be in the Glasshouse in the hilton Dubai creek, beautiful and they had a promotion on if you had two courses your drinks were 10 dirhams each!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dubai Like New York/Las Vegas/Paris All In 1”
Reviews.Author: buzzsolo1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay here booked all through the airmiles website (had been saving my miles with tesco clubcard points for about 3 years and got flight with ba and hotel by them for 15,790 miles had 16,000 so this was no problem. and even better feeling i didnt pay for it. Firstly have to say British Airways leg room far far better than virgin atlantic food was slightly better as well all the years i have been flying never had an upgrade but on return they upgraded us free to world traveller plus dont think i ever want to travel economy again!! we were spoilt rotten so much room and good food/drinks etc anyway on with the review We flew overnight and so arrived at the hotel about 8.30am check-in should be at 2pm but they offered an upgrade to a junior suite and said we could check in right away it cost £70 a night extra for the 2 of us but looking at all the benefits you got we felt it was well worth it we had access to a private executive lounge (very nice) for breakfast all day soft drinks and snacks and free booze 6.30 to 9pm at night plus hot food (soup and canopies etc) Madan was our butler what a guy he could not do enough for us he was a lovely lovely man always had a big smile on his face and would bring over olives,nuts and crisps all night to us if we wanted them. Our room was large with a seperate lounge and 2 huge flat screen tvs, seperate shower bath robes and slippers provided. very clean room with views over the Dubai creek as this is a city hotel not beach hotel. Only annoying thing was when we upgraded i asked if ok to pay in $ as i had some left from our trip to Las Vegas the previous month they said ok but then we got a letter next day under the door asking us to go to reception as they needed deposit in Dirhams so they gave me dollars back and i paid some in Dirhams next day got letter asking me to go to reception as they needed more money we were due to check out next morning so the night before went and sorted it all out just felt they really didnt trust as , as they also sent up someone to check the mini bar on departure to see if i owed anymore money which i didnt , also one other annoying thing to get into exec lounge you need to swipe your card in lift then press floor 8 our card never seemed to work and we had to keep going back to reception for them to re programme it , it was a bit embarrasing when other people got in the lift and your card didnt work !! anyway apart from these small probs hotel very plush all marbel,water and flowers oh and i must mention the crystal chandeliers all 3 off them magnificent as were the 2 glass lifts we were on the 3rd floor but loved the lifts so much kept getting in them (lazy cow i know) swimming pool on roof top very nice very warm up there and windy be carefull of the sun we didnt sit in it but still got burnt, pool guy Benjamin is also a really sweet man very very pleasant and helpfull want to know anything just ask him. only trip we went on because of the heat was big bus tour do city trip one day then beach the next as its 2 much to do both in one day well worth the money and it gets you to see all of Dubai - and what a place petrol is cheaper than water can u believe they have so much revenue coming in about 1.6billion a day they are build build build yes i suppose they will spoil it eventually but they will have claim to the biggest everything in the world i.e. airport,tallest building biggest shopping mall biggest indoor ski slope, biggest mono rail system due to open 09-09-09 Oh and Dubailand twice the size of Disney world florida they already have worlds only 7 star hotel in the Burj al arab you need to make a reservation to get in about 3 days in advance they do afternoon tea for about £56!! but worth it everything in there that looks gold is gold 24k gold leaf!! (will need to win lottery to stay their) got a free transfer back to airport included in exec package booze very cheap at airport you must buy here as you cannot in supermarkets in dubai only if you have alchol licence but we got litre of gordons gin for £6 at airport so stock up!! Would go back to Dubai again but on beach next time as city very hectic and traffic a nightmare but taxis very cheap so dont walk anywhere especially when its hot it was 42 when we were their this city reminds me of New York, Las Vegas and Paris all rolled into one, New York for the consentrated areas of high rise buildings,Las Vegas for the oppulence of its hotels and Paris for the spread out heavy traffic areas but do go and enjoy something for everyone here even the little ones especially when Dubailand gets fully open

Reviews.Title: “Check Your Booking”
Reviews.Author: PropmasterSouthport
Reviews.Content: We booked this the day before we left the UK, what a mistake. They had no information from Last Min .com when we arrived at 10:30am and so we where unable to book in. Even though we had the E-tickets and the confirmation emails, they refused to allow us to check in, although if we paid an additional £750 they did have a room for us After £200 worth of phone calls and email back to the UK. They finally allowed us to check at 3pm. Nice room good exec service just the check in problem spoilt the break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not great if you have a baby”
Reviews.Author: lynne34
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights on our way to austrailia and 3 nights on our return. I was traveling with my husband a 4 year old and a 9month old. For the first 3 nights we were upgraded to an executive room which was what i would have expected from a standard room and we had no problems. Staff were all friendly and helpful. However on our return journey we were in a standard room, a very small room, in which they had to remove a standard lamp and 2 chairs to fit in a bed for my 4 year old. The cot was like a laundry basket!! This request for the bed and cot took 9 Hours. The standard room is not equipt with a kettle so if you have a baby who requires food to heat up you have to ring room service to bring you hot water i find this ridiculous from a so called 5 star hotel. They are not quick on the requests it took 40 mins for them to bring water to the room hense a screaming baby. When asked if i could hire a kettle was told you have to be on the executive floor!! many discussions later i ended up going to the shops and buying a kettle was less stressful!! On the whole a nice hotel but wouldnt choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and service, enjoyable experience.”
Reviews.Author: HolidayInvestor
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Dubai airport, checked-out and then expected a driver from the hotel to pick us up. My wife and I, together with our baby, had to then ask someone at a kiosk for help, who was very kind to call the hotel, who unfortunately said the pick was not on their computer system. We then took a local taxi, whose advice not to take private or hotel taxis were very helpful as it saved us from overpaying for transport during our stay. Upon hearing our ordeal, we were offered a Suite which consisted of two TVs and a separate living room with very comfortable sofas. The following day we requested a Superior room in case they forget and we get charged for the Suite! We didnt get the fruit basket till next day but it was merely a bowl, nothing like a hamper or even a basket. The fruits were good though! We requested a cot which we got upon request. The ensuite was clean but the shower in the bath didnt work properly. The towels and bedsheets were changed everyday and room cleaned as usual. Room service was excellent, so was the breakfast, dinner and tea we occassionally ordered. We got a lot of pleasure out of get these services so didnt hesitate to give the staff tip everytime we needed something. We kept forgeting to buy washing liquid to clean our baby's bottles so we kept ordering it through room service which cost us lots of tips which also felt good. The staff were very friendly, excellent throughout including the doormen at the entrance who always helped us get taxis and give advice where to go. The receptionists were superb. The best thing about the hotel was its close proximity to the Gold Souk, great Indian restaurants, Museum and currency exchange bureaus who offered very good rates for £! I am glad we took local taxis to visit places like Jumeirah which felt great. On our last day we hired a local taxi for the whole day to give us a tour of places we hadnt visited and it only cost us 350 dhirams which is only £50. You'd be lucky to reach central London from Heathrow with this amount by a black cab?! Although we missed most breakfasts, the few that we did eat were very pleasant an experience and in gastronomy. The breakfast buffet here is better than most five star hotels in Spain except that it finishes at 10.30am so if you wake up late due to a late night out you have to take advantage of the all the great restaurants nearby which are very reasonably priced. The only thing I wasnt happy with was the pricing of designer goods in department stores. They vary little in comparison to prices in London. But shopping is best experienced in diamond selling jewellers where you pay less than what one would for gold! Great to see harmony between people of so many races. Not happy at all seeing some British tourists behaving uncourteously with people, eg not giving tips and giving up a taxi for a family with a baby.

Reviews.Title: “ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PussycatEngland
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights 1-4 april. Hotel was pleasent and staff ok, no extra bed in room and then the hotel wanted 150 dirhams per night £22.50) so my daughter slept on the sofa she is only 5 and this was adequate, Taxis requested at the lobby were hotel taxis and very expensive the staff were reluctant to flag local taxis so we walked 100 yards and did just that! Dubai is very safe and we often walked at night to other local hotels for a change and some where different to eat. BE WARNED checkout takes ages at this hotel they have no sense of urgency despite the proximity to the airport allow plenty of time. I would recommend this hotel for the 1st and last night stay in dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: irishone1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights....overall a good experience. Nice room...even though we had booked a triple the extra bed was not there on arrival (at nearly midnight). Booked hotel taxi from airport in advance....disaster finding it took over 40 mins! Discovered they hike the price...the journey with them cost 70 AED. The return journey in a local taxi, and the driver explained he was taking a less direct route to avoid traffic, was 22.50 AED!!!!! The breakfast was good and the food in the only restruant we tried was average. Staff are excellent and very helpful. swimming pool is small but nice and on the roof. Building very attractive and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “loved the roman style”
Reviews.Author: Charly98
Reviews.Content: Arrival was good, a guest relation officer called Anna was so cooperative, the rooms was fine, the DND sign was out of order, the toilet seat had a wooden cover, and the cleanliness of the room was fine.

Reviews.Title: “brill will use again!!!”
Reviews.Author: kirstylc
Reviews.Content: recently stayed at the metropolitan hotel for the week of chritmas staff were brilliant there was no job to difficult. the hotel had free bus to the mall of emirates certain times of day which would also pick up at different times. they also did a bus to there sister hotel that had its own private beach. (well worth going to for the day) hotel was very clean, always someone around to ask questions i couldnt fault the hotel so if others have they must have been looking for the bad points. i will defenatly be rebooking in the future!.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it - a pleasant surprise in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: TMSMonterrey_Mexico
Reviews.Content: I had to leave Abu Dhabi and come early to Dubai but my reservation at the JW Marriott was 4 days away, so my office reserved this hotel for me. I loved it - great location for walking, nice rooftop pool, excellent overall hotel done in the style of the Waldorf or a classic European hotel. Not a complaint to be made (unusual for me...), and the manager invited those of us who had been there for a few days to a cocktail reception one evening to get feedback. Shows what good administration can do for making a stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel- Wouldnt opt for city location again”
